item.title: At least seven reported dead as Maduro meets Venezuelan protests with force
item.dc:creator: Samantha Schmidt, Ana Herrero
item.description: Venezuelans rejected Maduro’s claim that he won reelection on Sunday, a result contradicted by independent exit polling and, the opposition says, the government’s own voting records.

item.title: Landslides, heavy rains kill at least 109 in south India’s Kerala state
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit, Anant Gupta
item.description: Downpours caused landslides in the hilly Wayanad district of southern India. Authorities fear the death toll will rise as bad weather complicates search-and-rescue efforts.

item.title: Third child dies after stabbing at Taylor Swift-themed dance class
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Hassan
item.description: The American singer wrote on Instagram that she was “completely in shock” after the mass stabbing attack.

item.title: U.S. will defend Israel if Hezbollah attacks from Lebanon, Austin says
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, Michael Birnbaum, Maham Javaid, Andrew Jeong
item.description: The U.S. defense secretary added that he hoped for a diplomatic solution, while Israeli officials reiterated their threat to respond to the deadly rocket attack from Lebanon.

item.title: Have babies for Russia: Putin presses women to embrace patriotism over feminism
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon, Francesca Ebel, Natalia Abbakumova
item.description: Women in Russia are being told to forgo education and careers to prioritize having many children, even as Putin’s war in Ukraine drains men from the workforce.

item.title: Blinken, Austin detail new U.S. security commitments for Philippines
item.dc:creator: Michael Birnbaum
item.description: The defense cooperation plans come as Manila seeks to bolster its ability to resist pressure from an increasingly assertive Chinese military in the South China Sea.

item.title: The Paris Olympics touted climate-friendly food. Athletes demanded more meat.
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack
item.description: What does a city proud of its culinary reputation, but also focused on the Olympics’ carbon footprint, serve to thousands of athletes seeking peak performance?

item.title: Images of a starving Palestinian boy went viral. The attention saved him.
item.dc:creator: Ruby Mellen, Joe Snell
item.description: Six-year-old Fadi al-Zant, a starving Palestinian boy, was saved by a viral photo during the Gaza hunger crisis.

item.title: World leaders, ordinary Venezuelans protest Maduro’s reelection claim
item.dc:creator: Samantha Schmidt, Ana Herrero, Leo Sands, Marina Dias
item.description: Authoritarian socialist Nicolás Maduro claimed reelection despite exit polling that showed challenger Edmundo González captured twice as many votes. The United States and others called for transparency.

item.title: Iran seeks to undermine Trump ahead of election, officials signal
item.dc:creator: Ellen Nakashima
item.description: The U.S. intelligence community says Iran probably views a Trump victory in November as worse for Tehran’s already poor relations with Washington.

item.title: Region braces for Netanyahu to decide Israeli response to Golan Heights strike
item.dc:creator: Steve Hendrix, Rachel Pannett, Niha Masih, Jennifer Hassan
item.description: As tensions rise after a deadly rocket attack launched from Lebanon, diplomats are urging restraint to prevent the war in Gaza from spilling into a regional conflict.

item.title: Palestinians recount deadly abuse in Israeli prisons: ‘It is Guantánamo’
item.dc:creator: Loveday Morris, Sufian Taha
item.description: The Post spoke to former Palestinian prisoners and lawyers and reviewed autopsy reports, revealing rampant violence and deprivation in Israel’s prison system.

item.title: Far right in uproar after Israel detains reservists over Gaza detainee abuse
item.dc:creator: Louisa Loveluck, Miriam Berger
item.description: Far-right demonstrators broke into Israel’s Sde Teiman base to protest the detentions of guards.

item.title: Two children killed, others critically wounded in mass stabbing in British seaside town
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih, William Booth
item.description: Police said they have detained a teenage boy in the stabbings in the town of Southport.

item.title: Simone Biles urged Rebeca Andrade to endure. Now she’s Biles’s top challenger.
item.dc:creator: Marina Dias, Terrence McCoy
item.description: The reigning world champion all-rounder and her Brazilian runner-up have formed a mutual admiration society.

item.title: We reported for months on changes sweeping Russia. Here’s what we found.
item.dc:creator: Washington Post staff
item.description: “Russia, Remastered” reveals how Vladimir Putin is harnessing the war in Ukraine to transform his own country and fulfill his vision of a restored superpower.

item.title: Artists say Putin’s push for patriotism is killing Russian culture
item.dc:creator: Francesca Ebel, Mary Ilyushina
item.description: Russian musicians, actors, writers and others who oppose the war are being exiled, while Putin compels artists remaining in Russia to demonstrate allegiance.

item.title: Migrants from China ‘walk the line’ to U.S. border, testing Biden and Xi
item.dc:creator: Cate Cadell, Nick Miroff, Li Qiang
item.description: The Post explores the largest wave of illegal U.S. border crossings by Chinese immigrants in history — part of a wider influx involving migrants from other nations.

item.title: Maduro declared winner of disputed Venezuelan election
item.dc:creator: Samantha Schmidt, Ana Herrero, María Luisa Paúl
item.description: The opposition, which had warned of the potential for fraud, was expected to challenge the result.

item.title: In Sudan’s catastrophe, food runs out as guns flow freely
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: The effects of the war in Sudan can be measured in superlatives: the world’s biggest internal displacement crisis, largest education crisis and biggest hunger crisis.

item.title: Warring parties in Sudan accused of carrying out rapes
item.dc:creator: Katharine Houreld, Hafiz Haroun
item.description: Allegations by Human Rights Watch that captive women were repeatedly raped jibes with Post reporting from inside Sudan. The RSF said to be the main perpetrator.

item.title: Paris Olympics organizers sorry for Last Supper at Opening Ceremonies
item.dc:creator: Anika Seth
item.description: The tableau included a woman in the role of Jesus and drag queens and gay icons as disciples. It was crashed by a man in blue as Dionysus, the Greek god of revelry.

item.title: Israel strikes deep in Lebanon after rocket attack, stoking fear of wider war
item.dc:creator: Heidi Levine, Rachel Pannett, Niha Masih, Kareem Fahim, Jennifer Hassan, Steve Hendrix
item.description: Israel had promised revenge for a rocket strike from Lebanon that killed 12 in the Golan Heights town of Majdal Shams. Hezbollah denied responsibility.
